head.title: The Lost Joys of Family Time

hedline.hl1: The Lost Joys of Family Time

abstract.p: Susan Cohen letter responds to June 13 news article on parents trying to reclaim their children's time; praises parents' moves to cut back on their children's activities in order to spend more time with them as a family; drawing

block.p: Re ''Parents Try to Reclaim Their Children's Time'' (news article, June 13):

Three cheers for the parents of Wayzata, Minn., for trying to cut back on their children's activities. Having dinner together as a family is vitally important, not just so parents can get to know their children but so children can get to know their parents.
Re ''Parents Try to Reclaim Their Children's Time'' (news article, June 13):

Three cheers for the parents of Wayzata, Minn., for trying to cut back on their children's activities. Having dinner together as a family is vitally important, not just so parents can get to know their children but so children can get to know their parents.

Equally important, and not mentioned, is the importance of unscheduled time for children to learn to entertain themselves. Imaginary games, building with blocks or reading a book for pleasure -- not soccer -- will create more balanced and successful adults.
SUSAN COHEN Berkeley Heights, N.J., June 13, 2000
